title: CSI star Gary Dourdan still looks just like character Warrick Brown
text:
Gary Dourdan attended the annual Global Gift Gala London and it felt like it was 2008 all over again (Picture: Getty Images)

It’s been over ten years since he graced the scenes as his character Warrick Brown and it’s like Gary Dourdan hasn’t aged a day.

The Hollywood star was among the many famous faces who showed up to support Eva Longoria’s Global Gift gala in London’s Kimpton Fitzroy Hotel on Thursday.

The actor, 52, cut a dapper figure in a classic black suit and white shirt combo as he made his way to the event.

And the sight of him surely gave CSI: Crime Scene Investigation fans a flashback of his time as Warrick Brown.

The actor played crime scene investigator Warrick from 2000 to 2008, when his character was shot and killed during the season eight finale.

He went on to have roles in shows such as Mistresses and Being Mary Jane, while he also starred in a number of films including Jumping The Broom and All She Wrote.

The actor and musician cut a dapper figure at Kimpton Fitzroy Hotelon Thursday (Picture: Getty Images)

The actor famously went through a rough patch in 2008 when he was arrested after police found him asleep in his car outside of Palm Springs, California, on April 28.

He was allegedly parked on the wrong side of the street with the car’s interior light on.

The actor played crime scene investigator Warrick from 2000 to 2008 – pictured with co-star Marg Helgenberger (Picture: Getty Images)

His time on the show came to an end when his character was shot and killed during the season eight finale (Picture: Getty Images)

The actor was charged with felony possession of heroin, cocaine and ecstasy but managed to avoid jail time after pleading guilty.

He was forced to complete 30 hours of a diversion program before his case was officially dismissed.

Nowadays, the talented star travels around the world performing his music as well as acting in projects.

Earlier in the week, he performed for the Mazzoleni Foundation in Venice and the star even walked away with a new award to boot!
